What is the difference between threat intelligence and cybersecurity?

Cybersecurity differs from threat intelligence in that instead of monitoring the threats, it activity combats attacks.

Blog

What is the Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP)?

A packaged product that integrates with existing tools and products, presenting a threat intelligence management system that automates and simplifies much of the work analysts have traditionally done themselves.
Glossary term

What is Spyware?

Software that is secretly or surreptitiously installed into an information system to gather information on individuals or organizations without their knowledge; a type of malicious code.
Glossary term

What is Spoofing?

“IP spoofing” refers to sending a network packet that appears to come from a source other than its actual source.
Glossary term

What is Spearphishing?

The fake email and login page will be specifically designed to be like the site of the company being hacked in emails.
Glossary term

What is Social Engineering?

A general term for attackers trying to trick people into revealing sensitive information or performing certain actions, such as downloading and executing files that appear to be benign but are actually malicious.
Glossary term

What is SOC?

A Security Operations Center (SOC) is a centralized unit that deals with security issues on an organizational and technical level. A SOC within a building or facility is a central location from where staff supervises the site, using data processing technology.
Glossary term

What is Signature-Based Detection?

The process of comparing signatures against observed events to identify possible incidents.
Glossary term

What is a Signature?

A recognizable, distinguishing pattern associated with an attack, such as a binary string in a virus or a particular set of keystrokes used to gain unauthorized access to a system.
Glossary term

What is Sightline?

NETSCOUT Sightline is an anomaly-detection and network traffic-analysis system which scales to provide complete edge-to-edge visibility into all network traffic ingressing, egressing, and travesing the largest networks in the world.
Glossary term

What is SIEM?

In the field of computer security, security information and event management Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) software products and services combine security information management (SIM) and security event management (SEM). They provide real-time analysis of security alerts generated by applications and network hardware.
Glossary term

Visibility Extended to Remote Medical Buildings for Protecting Healthcare Services

Overview of how a healthcare company protected the performance and availability of healthcare services, as well as end-user experience for doctors, nurses, and clinicians in a newly added medical building.
Blog

Security Risks of Stateful Network Architectures in the Digital Transformation Age

Digital Library Fulfillment Center The white paper you requested, Security Risks of Stateful Network Architectures in the Digital Transformation Age, is ready.
Thank You Page

Digital Transformation Renews State-Based Risk

State tracking and stateful devices, specifically firewalls, are popular components of enterprise security architecture. However, these firewalls and other infrastructure have introduced new DDoS attack vectors. Not just limited to substantial volumetric attacks, DDoS attacks often include application layer and state exhaustion attacks that impact business operations.
Landing Page

Smart Edge Monitoring

NETSCOUT Smart Edge Monitoring brings visibility throughout your ever-evolving, multi-cloud environment to solve performance issues affecting digital services across your technology and organizational boundaries.
Landing Page

Edge Adaptor for Smart Edge Monitoring

NETSCOUT’s innovative Smart Edge Monitoring (SEM) solution provides IT Managers real-time performance visibility into the digital experience of the distributed, modern workforce needed for business continuity, application performance, optimized employee productivity, and customer engagements. SEM extends service triage capabilities to the cloud, colocations, and client edges providing proactive network, application, and user experience management.
Product (New Design)

France Under Attack

A year in review: Detailed DDoS attack data for France
Blog

What is a Zero-Day Attack?

A previously-unknown attack vector which has been observed for the first time in the context of an actual attack
Glossary term

What is a Whitelist?

A list of discrete entities, such as hosts or applications, that are known to be benign.
Glossary term

What is Whaling?

Tricking key personnel within an organization in order to steal large amounts of money
Glossary term

What is Vulnerability Assessment?

Systematic examination of an information system or product to determine the adequacy of security measures
Glossary term

What is Vulnerability?

A weakness in a system that can be exploited to gain access to information, or cause an outage
Glossary term

What is Underblocking?

In the context of DDoS defense, inadvertent forwarding of illegitimate network traffic directed towards servers/applications/services/infrastructure which are under protection
Glossary term

What is Tuning?

Altering the configuration of an intrusion detection and prevention system to improve its detection accuracy.
Glossary term

What is Trusted Automated eXchange of Indicator (TAXII)?

Trusted Automated eXchange of Indicator is a protocol used to exchange cyber threat intelligence (CTI) over HTTPS. TAXII enables organizations to share CTI by defining an API that aligns with common sharing models.
Glossary term

What is Triangulation?

Identifying the physical location of a detected threat against a wireless network by estimating the threat’s approximate distance from multiple wireless sensors by the strength of the threat’s signal received by each sensor
Glossary term

What is TLS?

Transport Layer Security (TLS) is a cryptographic protocol that provides end-to-end communications security over networks and is widely used for internet communications and online transactions. TLS is the successor protocol to SSL.
Glossary term

What is a Threshold?

A value that sets the limit between normal and abnormal behavior.
Glossary term

What is the Threat Management System (TMS)?

The NETSCOUT Threat Management System in an intelligent DDoS mitigation system (IDMS) which can defend targeted servers, services, applications, networks, and ancillary supporting infrastructure from DDoS attacks. TMSes can be horizontally scaled in clusters and clusters of clusters, scaling to provide intelligent DDoS mitigation capacity for the largest networks on the Internet today and tomorrow.
Glossary term

Many government agencies have provided unprecedented support to their constituents during the pandemic. More than ever, these agencies have depended on reliably performing Unified Communications & Collaboration (UC&C) and Web platforms to deliver the State-level healthcare and unemployment
Case Study

What is the Threat Intelligence Gateway (TIG)?

High-scale, high-efficiency blocking of known threats at the perimeter, based on reputation: IP/Proto/Port, Domain, URL, TLS cert / JA3. A TIG can consumed and enforce 4+ million Indicators in memory with line-rate performance at 10Gbps+
Glossary term

What is a Threat Event?

An event or situation that has the potential for causing undesirable consequences or impact.
Glossary term

What is Threat Assessment?

Process of formally evaluating the degree of threat to an information system or enterprise and describing the nature of the threat.
Glossary term
